Hannah prayed,

“My heart has rejoiced in the Lord;

my horn has been raised high because of the Lord.

I have loudly denounced my enemies.

Indeed I rejoice in your deliverance.

No one is holy like the Lord!

There is no one other than you!

There is no rock like our God!

Don’t keep speaking so arrogantly.

Proud talk should not come out of your mouth,

for the Lord is a God who knows;

he evaluates what people do.

The bows of warriors are shattered,

but those who stumbled have taken on strength.

The well fed hire themselves out to earn food,

but the hungry no longer lack.

Even the barren woman has given birth to seven,

but the one with many children has declined.

The Lord both kills and gives life;

he brings down to the grave and raises up.

The Lord impoverishes and makes wealthy;

he humbles and he exalts.

He lifts the weak from the dust;

he raises the poor from the ash heap

to seat them with princes—

he bestows on them an honored position.

The foundations of the earth belong to the Lord—

he placed the world on them.

He watches over his holy ones,

but the wicked are made speechless in the darkness,

for it is not by one’s own strength that one prevails.

The Lord shatters his adversaries;

he thunders against them from the heavens.

The Lord executes judgment to the ends of the earth.

He will strengthen his king

and exalt the power of his anointed one.”

Then Elkanah went back home to Ramah.

The boy Samuel was serving the Lord with the favor of Eli the priest.
But the sons of Eli were wicked men. They did not acknowledge the Lord’s authority.

This was the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests’</st> <st data-num="04941" class="">routine</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>. Whenever <st data-num="03605 0376">anyone</st> was <st data-num="02076" class="">making</st> a <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest’s</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">attendant</st> would <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> with a <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st>-<st data-num="08127" class="">pronged</st> <st data-num="04207" class="">fork</st><n id="2" /> in his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, just as the <st data-num="01320" class="">meat</st> was <st data-num="01310" class="">boiling</st>.

He would jab it into the basin, kettle, cauldron, or pot. Everything that the fork would bring up the priest would take for himself. This is how they used to treat all the Israelites who came there to Shiloh.

Also, before they burned the fat the priest’s attendant would come and say to the person who was making the sacrifice, “Give some meat for the priest to roast! He won’t accept boiled meat from you, but only raw.”

If<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0376" class="">individual</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “They should <st data-num="06999" class="">certainly</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">burn</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="02459" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="06999" class="">away</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">first</st>, then <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> for yourself<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">whatever</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">you</st> <st data-num="08378" class="">wish</st>,”<n id="4" /> then he would <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">No</st>!<n id="5" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">Give</st> it <st data-num="03588 06258">now</st>! <st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st>, I’ll <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> it by <st data-num="02394" class="">force</st>!”<n id="6" />
The sin of these young men was very great in the Lord’s sight, for they treated the Lord’s offering with contempt.
Now Samuel was ministering with the favor of the Lord. The boy was dressed in a linen ephod.

His <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st> used to <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st> him a <st data-num="06996" class="">small</st> <st data-num="04598" class="">robe</st> and <st data-num="05927" class="">bring</st> it to him from <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st> to <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st> when she would <st data-num="05927" class="">go up</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> to <st data-num="02076" class="">make</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">annual</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st>.
Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife saying, “May the Lord establish descendants for you from this woman in place of the one that she dedicated to the Lord.” Then they would go to their home.
And indeed the Lord attended to Hannah. She got pregnant and gave birth to three sons and two daughters. But the boy Samuel grew up before the Lord.

Eli was very old. And he would hear about everything that his sons used to do to all the people of Israel and how they used to go to bed with the women who were stationed at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

So he <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to them, “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> do you <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">things</st>, these <st data-num="07451" class="">evil</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">things</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">hear about</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>?<n id="1" />
No, my sons! For the report that I hear circulating among the Lord’s people is not good.

If a man sins against a man, one may appeal to God on his behalf. But if a man sins against the Lord, who can intercede for him?” But Eli’s sons would not listen to their father. Indeed the Lord had decided to kill them.
However, the boy Samuel was growing up and finding favor both with the Lord and with people.
Then a man of God came to Eli and said to him, “This is what the Lord has said: ‘I plainly revealed myself to your ancestor’s house when they were slaves to the house of Pharaoh in Egypt.

I <st data-num="0977" class="">chose</st><n id="1" /> your ancestor<n id="2" /> from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07626" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> to be my <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, to <st data-num="05927" class="">offer sacrifice</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> my <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, to <st data-num="06999" class="">burn</st> <st data-num="07004" class="">incense</st>, and to <st data-num="05375" class="">bear</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="0646" class="">ephod</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> me. I <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> to your <st data-num="01" class="">ancestor’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0801" class="">fire offerings</st> made by the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>.

Why are you scorning my sacrifice and my offering that I commanded for my dwelling place? You have honored your sons more than you have me by having made yourselves fat from the best parts of all the offerings of my people Israel.’

“Therefore the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘I really did say that your house and your ancestor’s house would serve me forever.’ But now the Lord says, ‘May it never be! For I will honor those who honor me, but those who despise me will be cursed!

<st data-num="02009" class="">In fact</st>, <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> are <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st> when I will <st data-num="01438" class="">remove</st> your <st data-num="02220" class="">strength</st><n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="02220" class="">strength</st><n id="2" /> of your <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>. There will not <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> an <st data-num="02205" class="">old man</st> in your <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>!

You will <st data-num="05027" class="">see</st> <st data-num="06862" class="">trouble</st> in my <st data-num="04583" class="">dwelling place</st>!<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> will <st data-num="03605 0834 03190">experience blessings</st>,<n id="2" /> but there will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> an <st data-num="02205" class="">old man</st> in your<n id="3" /> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st>.<n id="4" />

Any <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> of yours that I do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">from</st> my <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, I will <st data-num="03615" class="">cause</st> his<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> <st data-num="03615" class="">to fail</st><n id="2" /> and will <st data-num="0109" class="">cause</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">him</st> <st data-num="0109" class="">grief</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> those <st data-num="04768" class="">born</st> to your <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st><n id="4" /> will <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st> by the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> of <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> will be a <st data-num="0226" class="">confirming sign</st> for you <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> will be <st data-num="0935" class="">fulfilled</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">through</st> your <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02652" class="">Hophni</st> and <st data-num="06372" class="">Phinehas</st>: in a <st data-num="0259" class="">single</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> they <st data-num="08147" class="">both</st> will <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st>!

Then I will <st data-num="06965" class="">raise up</st> for myself a <st data-num="0539" class="">faithful</st> <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>. He will <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> is in my <st data-num="03824" class="">heart</st> and <st data-num="05315" class="">soul</st>. I will <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st> for him a <st data-num="0539" class="">lasting</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">dynasty</st>,<n id="1" /> and he will <st data-num="01980 06440">serve</st> my <st data-num="04899" class="">chosen one</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st>.<n id="2" />
Everyone who remains in your house will come to bow before him for a little money and for a scrap of bread. Each will say, “Assign me to a priestly task so I can eat a scrap of bread.”’”
